intro: Chabraea suaveolens var. pinnatifida, commonly known as the sweet-smelling chabraea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
